title: How to Cook with Greek Yogurt

steps.headline: Substitute non-fat plain Greek yogurt for sour cream when you mix dip seasoning packets, like ranch flavoring and French onion soup.
Cut the measure of mayonnaise in a recipe.
steps.description: Substitute 1/2 to 3/4 of the mayonnaise you would ordinarily use with Greek yogurt.

steps.headline: Make creamy yogurt dressing.
steps.description: Chop up garlic, onions and your favorite herbs. Add 3 tbsp. (44 ml) of plain Greek yogurt and 1 tsp. (4.9 ml) of lemon juice. Shake the dressing in a jar to mix well. Pour it on your salad.

steps.headline: Flavor your seafood with a Greek yogurt sauce.
steps.description: Make the sauce by mixing 3 tbsp. (44 ml) plain Greek yogurt, 1 tsp. (4.9 ml) of Dijon mustard, and 1 tbsp. (1.9 g) of chopped fresh tarragon. Spread on the top of salmon, then bake it or mix with seafood to form a seafood salad.

steps.headline: Cook a party-ready avocado dip to serve with crackers or chips.
steps.description: Place 1 large avocado, 1/2 cup low-fat Greek yogurt (118 ml), the juice of 1 lime, 1/2 cup (8 g) of fresh cilantro and a pinch of sea salt and cayenne pepper in a food processor. Mix until creamy and serve within 2 days.

steps.headline: Spread pizza dough on a baking sheet.
steps.description: Cover the dough with a 1/4 inch (0.6 cm) layer of Greek yogurt. Top with roasted red peppers, roasted tomatoes, mushrooms or other vegetables. Finish with a layer of shredded mozzarella or feta cheese. Bake the pizza at 425 degrees Fahrenheit (218 Celsius) for 8 to 12 minutes.

steps.headline: Substitute plain low-fat Greek yogurt for heavy cream in Alfredo or vodka pasta.
steps.description: Alternatively, you can add 1 cup (237 ml) of Greek yogurt to tomato pasta just after you mix the sauce with the pasta and remove it from the heat. It forms an instant creamy tomato sauce.

steps.headline: Create “Greek yogurt cheese.” Cover a strainer with two layers of cheesecloth.
steps.description: Pour 4 to 12 oz. (118 to 354 ml) of 2 percent Greek yogurt in the strainer and let it strain for 2 to 4 hours. Mix in 1 tbsp. (15 ml) olive oil, salt, pepper and lemon zest, thyme, tarragon and basil to taste and place it the refrigerator for a few hours. Serve with fish tacos, gyros, pita bread or as you would serve cream cheese.

steps.headline: Improve your mac and cheese.
steps.description: Prepare your pasta and pulse some garlic and breadcrumbs in a food processor. Make the cheese sauce by heating 1 tbsp. (15 ml) of butter in a saucepan. Add 3 cloves of chopped garlic and a chopped onion. Sauté until they are translucent. Sprinkle 3 tbsp. (23 g) of white or rice flour. Stir and whisk in 3 cups (709 ml) of low-fat milk. Cook for 2 minutes. Mix 1 beaten egg and 1/2 cup (118 ml) of non-fat Greek yogurt together. Whisk into the sauce. Add 2 cups (160 g) of shredded smoked Gouda and salt and pepper to taste. Whisk until the cheese melts, then pour it over your cooked pasta. Pour it into a casserole dish, top with breadcrumbs and bake at 350 degrees Fahrenheit (177 Celsius) for 15 minutes.

steps.headline: Be the star of a barbecue with red curry coconut chicken.
steps.description: Mix a marinade of 1/2 cup (118 ml) non-fat Greek yogurt, 1/2 cup (118 ml) of coconut milk, 3 tbsp. (44 ml) red curry paste, 2 tbsp. (30 ml) fish sauce, lime juice and 1 tsp. (2.2 g) of turmeric. Marinate the chicken overnight, then grill it over direct heat for 5 minutes and over indirect heat for 25 minutes.

steps.headline: Craft Greek yogurt syrup.
steps.description: Get the creaminess of whipped cream with the health benefits of yogurt by combining fresh fruit, 1 tsp. (4.9 ml) of maple syrup and 2 oz. (59 ml) of Greek Yogurt in a food processor. Drizzle it on pancakes, waffles or muffins.

steps.headline: Make Greek yogurt ice cream.
steps.description: Mix 4 oz. (118 ml) of Greek yogurt with 1 tsp. (4.9 ml) of milk or almond milk and several drops of vanilla extract. Fill a freezer-safe container with the mixture and freeze it for 4 hours. Stir in pureed fresh fruit for a fruit ice cream. Combine 1 tsp. (2 g) of unsweetened cocoa powder for chocolate ice cream.

steps.headline: Substitute the buttermilk in baked goods with Greek yogurt.
steps.description: It should retain the moisture and increase the protein content of your pancakes, cupcakes and breads.

steps.headline: Turn cheesecake into yogurt cake.
steps.description: To make skinny peaches and cream yogurt cheesecake add 2 cups (473 ml) of fat free Greek yogurt, 1/2 cup (100 g) of granulated sugar, 2 eggs and 2 tsp. (10 ml) of vanilla extract to a blender. Once smooth, add 1 cup (225 g) of fresh peaches, 1 tbsp. (8 g) of cornstarch and a pinch of salt and blend. Pour the filling into a prepared graham cracker crust. Bake for 30 minutes at 350 degrees Fahrenheit (177 Celsius). Turn the oven off and let it sit in the oven for 5 minutes, and then refrigerate for 2 to 3 hours before serving.

steps.headline: Make a sweet peanut butter or Nutella dip.
steps.description: Add 1.5 cups (355 ml) of vanilla Greek yogurt, a pinch of cinnamon and 1/2 cup (118 ml) of creamy peanut butter or 2 tbsp. (30 ml) of Nutella (hazelnut chocolate spread) to a food processor. Mix until well combined and serve with wafer cookies, bananas or other fresh fruit.

steps.headline: Whip up Greek yogurt mousse.
steps.description: Mix 4 oz. (118 ml) of vanilla Greek yogurt with 1 tbsp. (5 g) of unsweetened cocoa powder. Process them together in a blender.
